summary: This is a transcript of a grand jury proceeding in the Southern District of New York on July 8, 2020, where an Assistant United States Attorney presents a proposed superseding indictment against Ghislaine Maxwell. The proceeding is brief, focusing solely on correcting two clerical errors (docket numbers) in the perjury counts of an indictment the grand jury had returned the previous week. No new evidence or witnesses are presented.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The individual charged in the six-count superseding indictment being presented to the grand jury. The charges include perjury counts related to her 2016 deposition testimony.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Mentioned by the prosecutor when asking grand jurors if they have outside knowledge about the case involving Ghislaine Maxwell, Jeffrey Epstein, or anyone else related.

persons.name: FBI Special Agent
persons.context: Referenced as having given testimony to the grand jury the previous week. The transcript of that testimony is marked as Grand Jury Exhibit 3.

connections.description: Implied connection as the prosecutor groups them together when asking grand jurors about prior knowledge of 'this case'.

events.title: Initial Grand Jury Appearance
events.description: An earlier appearance in the case against Ghislaine Maxwell, referenced in the header of the transcript.

events.title: Grand Jury Presentation for Superseding Indictment
events.description: A grand jury proceeding where an AUSA presents a proposed superseding indictment against Ghislaine Maxwell to correct clerical errors in two perjury counts.

events.title: Maxwell's First Deposition
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell gave deposition testimony in a civil case (docket 15 Civ. 7433). This testimony is the basis for one of the perjury counts.

events.title: Maxwell's Second Deposition
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell gave a second round of deposition testimony in the same civil case (docket 15 Civ. 7433). This testimony is the basis for another perjury count.

events.title: Prior Grand Jury Indictment
events.description: The grand jury returned an initial six-count indictment against Ghislaine Maxwell the week before this proceeding (implied date: late June/early July 2020).

locations: United States Courthouse, 300 Quaroppas Street, White Plains, New York
keyFacts: The grand jury proceeding was solely to correct two clerical errors (incorrect docket numbers) in a previously returned indictment against Ghislaine Maxwell.
The perjury charges against Maxwell are based on deposition testimony she gave on April 22, 2016, and July 22, 2016, in civil case number 15 Civ. 7433.
The prosecutor confirmed that no new evidence or witnesses were being presented; the grand jury was to base its decision on the same evidence from the prior week.
Virtually all grand jurors indicated they had heard or read about Ghislaine Maxwell, Jeffrey Epstein, or the case prior to the proceeding.
The proceeding was very short, beginning at 10:05 a.m. and concluding at 10:14 a.m.
